intro: Aniselytron epileuca, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is native to regions in Africa, Asia, and the Americas, and is often found in disturbed soils and agricultural areas. Due to its rapid growth and invasive potential, it is considered a weed in many parts of the world.
